# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can use the following code to wrap text at a certain width:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str)
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        
        result *= "$word "
        line_length += length(word) + 1 # add 1 for the space
    end
    
    return chomp(result) # remove trailing newline
end
```

This function splits the input string into words and then iterates over these words. If a word would make the line too long, it starts a new line. The length of each word is calculated as `length(word) + 1` because we need to add an extra space after each word. 

You can use this function with some example text like:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

The output of the above code will be:

```
Lorem ipsum 
dolor sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit.
```
